name: Vibrio fischeri ES114
description: Vibrio fischeri strain ES114. This strain was isolated from the light organs of the squid Euprymna scolopes. Interestingly; the genome encodes a cholera toxin phage-like element on chromosome II. However; the cluster of genes responsible for phage excision is missing; and the two CTS genes have been replaces. There are also a number of pilus synthesis genes present in the genome; which may function during symbiosis. Comparison of the genome from this organism and the pathogenic Vibrio spp. will shed light on both the virulence as well as symbiosis-establishing mechanisms.
